title: Public transport for the NRL Qualifying Final – Melbourne Storm v Cronulla-Sutherland Sharks
articleContent:
NRL Finals are back at AAMI Park! Melbourne Storm takes on the Cronulla-Sutherland Sharks in a matchup sure to deliver edge-of-your-seat action and public transport is your best way to enjoy it. We're running extra services to get you to and from AAMI Park on Saturday 14 September.  

The event begins at 4:05pm. 

Before you travel

Plan your journey using Journey planner. Check Disruptions for service changes that may affect your journey.

 Metropolitan train

We're running extra trains to get you home from the game.

Return services from Richmond Station 

  • Ringwood – leaving from Platform 9 
  • Glen Waverley – leaving from Platform 10 

Revisit this page for updates to train times.  

 Metropolitan tram

We're running extra trams before and after the game.  

Getting to and from AAMI Park 

Route 70 

  • Extra trams run between Flinders Street / Elizabeth Street (Stop 4) and Stop 7C MCG/John Cain Arena. 

 Metropolitan bus

Catch a Route 246 bus close to the MCG.

 Regional train

Normal services run to and from Southern Cross Station. Catch a Route 70 tram via Flinders Street or a metropolitan train to Richmond Station to get to the AAMI Park.
